meanings.definition: A person or thing that trembles.
meanings.sent1: The small dog was one of the tremblers at the shelter.
meanings.sent2: The leaves on the tree were tremblers in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The tremblers in the haunted house made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The tremblers in the earthquake were felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent5: The tremblers in the old building were a sign of its age.

meanings.definition: A device that causes something to tremble.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake machine was a powerful trembler.
meanings.sent2: The massage chair was a gentle trembler for relaxation.
meanings.sent3: The little trembler on the table made the dishes rattle.
meanings.sent4: The tiny trembler in the car seat soothed the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The handheld trembler was used to mix the paint thoroughly.

meanings.definition: A feeling of fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The dark forest filled her with tremblers.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't shake off the tremblers before the big test.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie gave him tremblers that lasted all night.
meanings.sent4: The tremblers in her heart made her hesitate before speaking.
meanings.sent5: The tremblers in the haunted house tour were all in good fun.
